trans-unit.source: The following steps demonstrate how to connect to the SQL Server instance over the internet using SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS).
trans-unit.target: The following steps demonstrate how to connect to the SQL Server instance over the internet using SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS).

trans-unit.source: However, the same steps apply to making your SQL Server virtual machine accessible for your applications, running both on-premises and in Azure.
trans-unit.target: However, the same steps apply to making your SQL Server virtual machine accessible for your applications, running both on-premises and in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Before you can connect to the instance of SQL Server from another VM or the internet, you must complete the following tasks as described in the sections that follow:
trans-unit.target: Before you can connect to the instance of SQL Server from another VM or the internet, you must complete the following tasks as described in the sections that follow:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Create a TCP endpoint for the virtual machine</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Create a TCP endpoint for the virtual machine</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Open TCP ports in the Windows firewall</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Open TCP ports in the Windows firewall</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Configure SQL Server to listen on the TCP protocol</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Configure SQL Server to listen on the TCP protocol</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Configure SQL Server for mixed mode authentication</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Configure SQL Server for mixed mode authentication</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Create SQL Server authentication logins</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Create SQL Server authentication logins</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Determine the DNS name of the virtual machine</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Determine the DNS name of the virtual machine</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Connect to the Database Engine from another computer</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Connect to the Database Engine from another computer</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The connection path is summarized by the following diagram:
trans-unit.target: The connection path is summarized by the following diagram:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connecting to a SQL Server virtual machine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connecting to a SQL Server virtual machine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Create a TCP endpoint for the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Create a TCP endpoint for the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: In order to access SQL Server from the internet, the virtual machine must have an endpoint to listen for incoming TCP communication.
trans-unit.target: In order to access SQL Server from the internet, the virtual machine must have an endpoint to listen for incoming TCP communication.

trans-unit.source: This Azure configuration step, directs incoming TCP port traffic to a TCP port that is accessible to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This Azure configuration step, directs incoming TCP port traffic to a TCP port that is accessible to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: If you are connecting within the same cloud service or virtual network, you do not have to create a publically accessible endpoint.
trans-unit.target: If you are connecting within the same cloud service or virtual network, you do not have to create a publically accessible endpoint.

trans-unit.source: In that case, you could continue to the next step.
trans-unit.target: In that case, you could continue to the next step.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Connection Scenarios</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Connection Scenarios</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure Management Portal, click on VIRTUAL MACHINES.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure Management Portal, click on VIRTUAL MACHINES.

trans-unit.source: Click on your newly created virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click on your newly created virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Information about your virtual machine is presented.
trans-unit.target: Information about your virtual machine is presented.

trans-unit.source: Near the top of the page, select the ENDPOINTS page, and then at the bottom of the page, click ADD.
trans-unit.target: Near the top of the page, select the ENDPOINTS page, and then at the bottom of the page, click ADD.

trans-unit.source: On the Add an Endpoint to a Virtual Machine page, click Add a Stand-alone Endpoint, and then click the Next arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: On the Add an Endpoint to a Virtual Machine page, click Add a Stand-alone Endpoint, and then click the Next arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the Specify the details of the endpoint page, provide the following information.
trans-unit.target: On the Specify the details of the endpoint page, provide the following information.

trans-unit.source: In the NAME box, provide a name for the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: In the NAME box, provide a name for the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: In the PROTOCOL box, select TCP.
trans-unit.target: In the PROTOCOL box, select TCP.

trans-unit.source: You may type 57500 in the PUBLIC PORT box.
trans-unit.target: You may type 57500 in the PUBLIC PORT box.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, you may type SQL Server's default listening port 1433 in the Private Port box.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, you may type SQL Server's default listening port 1433 in the Private Port box.

trans-unit.source: Note that many organizations select different port numbers to avoid malicious security attacks.
trans-unit.target: Note that many organizations select different port numbers to avoid malicious security attacks.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to continue.

trans-unit.source: The endpoint is created.
trans-unit.target: The endpoint is created.

trans-unit.source: Open TCP ports in the Windows firewall for the default instance of the Database Engine
trans-unit.target: Open TCP ports in the Windows firewall for the default instance of the Database Engine

trans-unit.source: Connect to the virtual machine via Windows Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the virtual machine via Windows Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: Once logged in, at the Start screen, type WF.msc, and then hit ENTER.
trans-unit.target: Once logged in, at the Start screen, type WF.msc, and then hit ENTER.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Start the Firewall Program</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Start the Firewall Program</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security, in the left pane, right-click Inbound Rules, and then click New Rule in the action pane.
trans-unit.target: In the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security, in the left pane, right-click Inbound Rules, and then click New Rule in the action pane.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Rule</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Rule</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the New Inbount Rule Wizard dialog box, under Rule Type, select Port, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the New Inbount Rule Wizard dialog box, under Rule Type, select Port, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Protocol and Ports dialog, use the default TCP.
trans-unit.target: In the Protocol and Ports dialog, use the default TCP.

trans-unit.source: In the Specific local ports box, then type the port number of the instance of the Database Engine (1433 for the default instance or your choice for the private port in the endpoint step).
trans-unit.target: In the Specific local ports box, then type the port number of the instance of the Database Engine (1433 for the default instance or your choice for the private port in the endpoint step).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TCP Port 1433</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TCP Port 1433</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Action dialog box, select Allow the connection, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Action dialog box, select Allow the connection, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Security Note: Selecting Allow the connection if it is secure can provide additional security.
trans-unit.target: Security Note: Selecting Allow the connection if it is secure can provide additional security.

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you want to configure additional security options in your environment.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you want to configure additional security options in your environment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Allow Connections</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Allow Connections</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Profile dialog box, select Public, Private, and Domain.
trans-unit.target: In the Profile dialog box, select Public, Private, and Domain.

trans-unit.source: Then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Security Note: Selecting Public allows access over the internet.
trans-unit.target: Security Note: Selecting Public allows access over the internet.

trans-unit.source: Whenever possible, select a more restrictive profile.
trans-unit.target: Whenever possible, select a more restrictive profile.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Public Profile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Public Profile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Name dialog box, type a name and description for this rule, and then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: In the Name dialog box, type a name and description for this rule, and then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Rule Name</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Rule Name</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Open additional ports for other components as needed.
trans-unit.target: Open additional ports for other components as needed.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Configuring the Windows Firewall to Allow SQL Server Access</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Configuring the Windows Firewall to Allow SQL Server Access</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure SQL Server to listen on the TCP protocol
trans-unit.target: Configure SQL Server to listen on the TCP protocol

trans-unit.source: While connected to the virtual machine, on the Start page, type SQL Server Configuration Manager and hit ENTER.
trans-unit.target: While connected to the virtual machine, on the Start page, type SQL Server Configuration Manager and hit ENTER.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Open SSCM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Open SSCM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In SQL Server Configuration Manager, in the console pane, expand SQL Server Network Configuration.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Server Configuration Manager, in the console pane, expand SQL Server Network Configuration.

trans-unit.source: In the console pane, click Protocols for MSSQLSERVER (he default instance name.)
trans-unit.target: In the console pane, click Protocols for MSSQLSERVER (he default instance name.)

trans-unit.source: In the details pane, right-click TCP, it should be Enabled for the gallery images by default.
trans-unit.target: In the details pane, right-click TCP, it should be Enabled for the gallery images by default.

trans-unit.source: For your custom images, click Enable (if its status is Disabled.)
trans-unit.target: For your custom images, click Enable (if its status is Disabled.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable TCP</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable TCP</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the console pane, click SQL Server Services.
trans-unit.target: In the console pane, click SQL Server Services.

trans-unit.source: In the details pane, right-click SQL Server (_instance name_) (the default instance is SQL Server (MSSQLSERVER)), and then click Restart, to stop and restart the instance of SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: In the details pane, right-click SQL Server (_instance name_) (the default instance is SQL Server (MSSQLSERVER)), and then click Restart, to stop and restart the instance of SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Restart Database Engine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Restart Database Engine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Close SQL Server Configuration Manager.
trans-unit.target: Close SQL Server Configuration Manager.

trans-unit.source: For more information about enabling protocols for the SQL Server Database Engine, see <link><linkText>Enable or Disable a Server Network Protocol</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about enabling protocols for the SQL Server Database Engine, see <link><linkText>Enable or Disable a Server Network Protocol</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure SQL Server for mixed mode authentication
trans-unit.target: Configure SQL Server for mixed mode authentication

trans-unit.source: The SQL Server Database Engine cannot use Windows Authentication without domain environment.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Server Database Engine cannot use Windows Authentication without domain environment.

trans-unit.source: To connect to the Database Engine from another computer, configure SQL Server for mixed mode authentication.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the Database Engine from another computer, configure SQL Server for mixed mode authentication.

trans-unit.source: Mixed mode authentication allows both SQL Server Authentication and Windows Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Mixed mode authentication allows both SQL Server Authentication and Windows Authentication.

trans-unit.source: Configuring mixed mode authentication might not be necessary if you have configured an Azure Virtual Network with a configured domain environment.
trans-unit.target: Configuring mixed mode authentication might not be necessary if you have configured an Azure Virtual Network with a configured domain environment.

trans-unit.source: While connected to the virtual machine, on the Start page, type SQL Server 2014 Management Studio and click the selected icon.
trans-unit.target: While connected to the virtual machine, on the Start page, type SQL Server 2014 Management Studio and click the selected icon.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Start SSMS</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Start SSMS</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The first time you open Management Studio it must create the users Management Studio environment.
trans-unit.target: The first time you open Management Studio it must create the users Management Studio environment.

trans-unit.source: This may take a few moments.
trans-unit.target: This may take a few moments.

trans-unit.source: Management Studio presents the Connect to Server dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Management Studio presents the Connect to Server dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the Server name box, type the name of the virtual machine to connect to the Database Engine with the Object Explorer.
trans-unit.target: In the Server name box, type the name of the virtual machine to connect to the Database Engine with the Object Explorer.

trans-unit.source: (Instead of the virtual machine name you can also use (local) or a single period as the Server name.
trans-unit.target: (Instead of the virtual machine name you can also use (local) or a single period as the Server name.

trans-unit.source: Select Windows Authentication, and leave _your_VM_name_\your_local_administrator in the User name box.
trans-unit.target: Select Windows Authentication, and leave _your_VM_name_\your_local_administrator in the User name box.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect to Server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect to Server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In SQL Server Management Studio Object Explorer, right-click the name of the instance of SQL Server (the virtual machine name), and then click Properties.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Server Management Studio Object Explorer, right-click the name of the instance of SQL Server (the virtual machine name), and then click Properties.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Server Properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Server Properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Security page, under Server authentication, select SQL Server and Windows Authentication mode, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: On the Security page, under Server authentication, select SQL Server and Windows Authentication mode, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select Authentication Mode</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select Authentication Mode</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SQL Server Management Studio dialog box, click OK to acknowledge the requirement to restart SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: In the SQL Server Management Studio dialog box, click OK to acknowledge the requirement to restart SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: In Object Explorer, right-click your server, and then click Restart.
trans-unit.target: In Object Explorer, right-click your server, and then click Restart.

trans-unit.source: (If SQL Server Agent is running, it must also be restarted.)
trans-unit.target: (If SQL Server Agent is running, it must also be restarted.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Restart</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Restart</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SQL Server Management Studio dialog box, click Yes to agree that you want to restart SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: In the SQL Server Management Studio dialog box, click Yes to agree that you want to restart SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Create SQL Server authentication logins
trans-unit.target: Create SQL Server authentication logins

trans-unit.source: To connect to the Database Engine from another computer, you must create at least one SQL Server authentication login.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the Database Engine from another computer, you must create at least one SQL Server authentication login.

trans-unit.source: In SQL Server Management Studio Object Explorer, expand the folder of the server instance in which you want to create the new login.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Server Management Studio Object Explorer, expand the folder of the server instance in which you want to create the new login.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Security folder, point to New, and select Login....
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Security folder, point to New, and select Login....

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Login</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Login</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Login - New dialog box, on the General page, enter the name of the new user in the Login name box.
trans-unit.target: In the Login - New dialog box, on the General page, enter the name of the new user in the Login name box.

trans-unit.source: Select SQL Server authentication.
trans-unit.target: Select SQL Server authentication.

trans-unit.source: In the Password box, enter a password for the new user.
trans-unit.target: In the Password box, enter a password for the new user.

trans-unit.source: Enter that password again into the Confirm Password box.
trans-unit.target: Enter that password again into the Confirm Password box.

trans-unit.source: To enforce password policy options for complexity and enforcement, select Enforce password policy (recommended).
trans-unit.target: To enforce password policy options for complexity and enforcement, select Enforce password policy (recommended).

trans-unit.source: This is a default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.
trans-unit.target: This is a default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.

trans-unit.source: To enforce password policy options for expiration, select Enforce password expiration (recommended).
trans-unit.target: To enforce password policy options for expiration, select Enforce password expiration (recommended).

trans-unit.source: Enforce password policy must be selected to enable this checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Enforce password policy must be selected to enable this checkbox.

trans-unit.source: This is a default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.
trans-unit.target: This is a default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.

trans-unit.source: To force the user to create a new password after the first time the login is used, select User must change password at next login (Recommended if this login is for someone else to use.
trans-unit.target: To force the user to create a new password after the first time the login is used, select User must change password at next login (Recommended if this login is for someone else to use.

trans-unit.source: If the login is for your own use, do not select this option.)
trans-unit.target: If the login is for your own use, do not select this option.)

trans-unit.source: Enforce password expiration must be selected to enable this checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Enforce password expiration must be selected to enable this checkbox.

trans-unit.source: This is a default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.
trans-unit.target: This is a default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.

trans-unit.source: From the Default database list, select a default database for the login.
trans-unit.target: From the Default database list, select a default database for the login.

trans-unit.source: master is the default for this option.
trans-unit.target: master is the default for this option.

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created a user database, leave this set to master.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created a user database, leave this set to master.

trans-unit.source: In the Default language list, leave default as the value.
trans-unit.target: In the Default language list, leave default as the value.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Login Properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Login Properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If this is the first login you are creating, you may want to designate this login as a SQL Server administrator.
trans-unit.target: If this is the first login you are creating, you may want to designate this login as a SQL Server administrator.

trans-unit.source: If so, on the Server Roles page, check sysadmin.
trans-unit.target: If so, on the Server Roles page, check sysadmin.

trans-unit.source: Security Note: Members of the sysadmin fixed server role have complete control of the Database Engine.
trans-unit.target: Security Note: Members of the sysadmin fixed server role have complete control of the Database Engine.

trans-unit.source: You should carefully restrict membership in this role.
trans-unit.target: You should carefully restrict membership in this role.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>sysadmin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>sysadmin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: For more information about SQL Server logins, see <link><linkText>Create a Login</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about SQL Server logins, see <link><linkText>Create a Login</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Determine the DNS name of the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Determine the DNS name of the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: To connect to the SQL Server Database Engine from another computer, you must know the Domain Name System (DNS) name of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the SQL Server Database Engine from another computer, you must know the Domain Name System (DNS) name of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: (This is the name the internet uses to identify the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: (This is the name the internet uses to identify the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can use the IP address, but the IP address might change when Azure moves resources for redundancy or maintenance.
trans-unit.target: You can use the IP address, but the IP address might change when Azure moves resources for redundancy or maintenance.

trans-unit.source: The DNS name will be stable because it can be redirected to a new IP address.)
trans-unit.target: The DNS name will be stable because it can be redirected to a new IP address.)

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal (or from the previous step), select VIRTUAL MACHINES.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal (or from the previous step), select VIRTUAL MACHINES.

trans-unit.source: On the VIRTUAL MACHINE INSTANCES page, under the Quick Glance column, find and copy the DNS name for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: On the VIRTUAL MACHINE INSTANCES page, under the Quick Glance column, find and copy the DNS name for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>DNS name</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>DNS name</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Connect to the Database Engine from another computer
trans-unit.target: Connect to the Database Engine from another computer

trans-unit.source: On a computer connected to the internet, open SQL Server Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: On a computer connected to the internet, open SQL Server Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: In the Connect to Server or Connect to Database Engine dialog box, in theServer name box, enter the DNS name of the virtual machine (determined in the previous task) and a public endpoint port number in the format of DNSName,portnumber such as tutorialtestVM.cloudapp.net,57500.
trans-unit.target: In the Connect to Server or Connect to Database Engine dialog box, in theServer name box, enter the DNS name of the virtual machine (determined in the previous task) and a public endpoint port number in the format of DNSName,portnumber such as tutorialtestVM.cloudapp.net,57500.

trans-unit.source: To get the port number, log in to the Azure Management Portal and find the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: To get the port number, log in to the Azure Management Portal and find the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: On the Dashboard, click ENDPOINTS and use the PUBLIC PORT assigned to MSSQL.
trans-unit.target: On the Dashboard, click ENDPOINTS and use the PUBLIC PORT assigned to MSSQL.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Public Port</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Public Port</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Authentication box, select SQL Server Authentication.
trans-unit.target: In the Authentication box, select SQL Server Authentication.

trans-unit.source: In the Login box, type the name of a login that you created in an earlier task.
trans-unit.target: In the Login box, type the name of a login that you created in an earlier task.

trans-unit.source: In the Password box, type the password of the login that you create in an earlier task.
trans-unit.target: In the Password box, type the password of the login that you create in an earlier task.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect using SSMS</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect using SSMS</linkText>
